channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for TN

item.title: Report X-2025052116
item.description:
Report X-2025052116

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-23
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During sort operations at the MEMH location a fiberboard box was dropped during the unloading process. It contained one metal can that was damaged on the bottom chime causing the release. The shipment was placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2025051541
item.description:
Report X-2025051541

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-18
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 5/18/2025 at approximately 1715, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 223990 at the hub facility in Memphis, reporting a dangerous goods spill. The shipment consisted of one metal can of paint overpacked in a fiberboard box. Due of mishandling, the package was damaged, resulting in spillage. The shipment was placed in a salvage drum and awaits an amended shipper's declaration for further transport.

item.title: Report X-2025051321
item.description:
Report X-2025051321

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-17
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 5/17/2025, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 506210 at the hub facility in Memphis, reporting a flammable liquid spill. The shipment consisted of one steel drum, which sustained a small puncture on its bottom rim, resulting in spillage. The cause of the damage is unknown. The drum was placed inverted into a salvage package and awaits and amended shipper's declaration for further transport.

item.title: Report X-2025051540
item.description:
Report X-2025051540

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-17
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 5/17/2025 at approximately 0530, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 5243686 at the hub facility in Memphis, reporting a dangerous goods spill. The shipment consisted of one fiberboard box containing one glass bottle. Due to mishandling, the shipment was damaged resulting in spillage. The shipment was place in a salvage drum and will be set for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2025051320
item.description:
Report X-2025051320

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-17
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 5/17/2025 at approximately 0345, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 5243686 at the hub facility in Memphis, reporting a flammable liquid spill. The shipment consisted of 5 fiberboard boxes; each appeared to contain 2 metal cans. The package with the tracking number ending in - 2823, was damaged due from the spillage of one of its cans. The package was placed in a salvage drum and awaits an amended shipper's declaration for further transport.

item.description:
Report X-2025060159

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-14
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The shipment was discovered leaking during sort operations. Inner contents: 15 glass bottles @ 1 Liter bottles. 3 bottles were broken. Bottles were labelled at : IPX643 SS 100 MG/G.001, Batch IPX643-muminja1-017, Netto 1000 g, 04.Mar.2025, J.Muminovic. All remaining contents were placed in a salvage drum and held pending disposition from the shipper.

item.description:
Report X-2025051543

  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During sort operations at the MEMH location a fiberboard box was found with signs of a release. The fiberboard box contained plastic bottles with screw tops. The screw cap on three bottles came of spilling the contents inside of the fiberboard box. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2025050975
item.description:
Report X-2025050975

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-13
  • City: HUMBOLDT
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 13th during the PM sort a FedEx clinical pak labeled as UN3373 was discovered to be slightly wet. The majority of the liquid was contained inside the clinical pak but it was determined that the inner receptacles did open up allowing the liquid to be released inside the outer packaging. The package was secured and the shipper notified to come and retrieve the package. The NRC was also notified and a report was filed.

item.title: Report X-2025050925
item.description:
Report X-2025050925

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-09
  • City: KNOXVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: NORFOLK SOUTHERN CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Elliott Austin was contacted by Mechanical in Knoxville, Tn about a possible leaking Tank Car in the yard. DOWX 49288 was found to have leaked product on to the housing and outer surface of the Tank Car. There was an estimated loss of less than 3 gallons on the Tank. There was no noted loss to the ground or other surrounding cars. Upon inspection by a contractor, it was found that the 4 manway swing bolts were found less than tool tight

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER RECEIVED A CALL ON THE RADIO IN REGARD TO A PACKAGE THAT APPEARED TO BE LEAKING. UPON ARRIVAL AND INSPECTION, USED THE DECISION TREE TO TREAT THE PACKAGE AS A LEAKING HAZMAT. ALL PROTOCOLS IN REGARD TO PPE AND DELAING WITH THE PACKAGE WERE FOLLOWED BEFORE TRANSFERRING THE PACKAGE FOR PROCESSING.

item.title: Report E-2025050207
item.description:
Report E-2025050207

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-09
  • City: CHATTANOOGA
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 9, 2025, one (1) 5-gallon pail of paint was crushed in transit and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the wooden pallet and trailer floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the site. The crew utilized granular absorbents, cleansers, and hand tools to remove the spent product. The damaged pail was containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum and all spent absorbents and debris were containerized in one (1) additional 55-gallon drum.

item.title: Report X-2025051393
item.description:
Report X-2025051393

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-21
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: ILLINOIS CENTRAL RAILROAD COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 30000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 04.21.2025, a CN transportation employee observed tank car, GATX217272, Load, UN1760, to be leaking from the bottom at the Woodstock Yard, Memphis, TN. All appropriate notifications made. DGO Vaughan responded to the Woodstock Yard and conducted an inspection of the tank car. A slow leak was discharging from the area inside the skid protection housing, above the BOV flanged nozzle and cap. The BOV cap and BOV valve handle were confirmed to be tool-tight and fully closed. Due to the skid protection covering plate and BOV flanged nozzle design, the BOV could not be inspected to determine the cause of the leak. The leak was contained, and the tank cars' contents were transloaded into tank car # GATX37296, which was sourced from within the CN Woodstock yard. The tank car was then cleaned and purged of all hazardous materials.

item.title: Report E-2025050267
item.description:
Report E-2025050267

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-17
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 06:41 EST, ERTS was contacted by XPO (BNA) about a cargo release. It was reported that due to a forklift incident, approximately 2 gallons of Polane P Conductive Primer (hazardous - UN1263) was released. The caller stated that the released product was contained to the dock floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and they felt comfortable cleaning the release donning the proper PPE per SDS. The released product, damaged drum, and oil-dri will be placed into a 75-gallon metal drum and staged in OS&D. There were no drains, soils or waterways reported to have been impacted by the release.

It was reported that approximately 3 quarts of 4-100 adhesive released from a metal pail due to unknown cause, top of the pail popped open. The release impacted inside trailer#311-1727. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. 234307-1 20-gallon metal drum - impacted can, oil dri, product.

item.title: Report E-2025050141
item.description:
Report E-2025050141

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-09
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0518 EDT on 4/9, XPO-BNA contacted ERTS to report a spill of 2 quarts of Ethanol 200 Proof from a 1-gallon poly bottle onto the trailer and dock floors. The bottle was punctured by a forklift at BNA. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller, who felt comfortable cleaning the spill with terminal-issued PPE. ERTS generated waste ID: 233388-1. ERTS reported the spill to Chemtrec and spoke to Esta, who provided report number: 2025040900037
